clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: If you choose to take on that client, then you need to represent them just like if they were a multimillion dollar deal.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Kristee speaks in complete, measured sentences with practical clarity — no fluff, no hype, just matter-of-fact wisdom from someone who's done the work.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It challenges the hidden belief that treating small clients differently is smart business strategy, when it's actually what's keeping you stuck.

HOOK.text: The agent doing $50 million a year still works rentals.
HOOK.production_note: Text on screen: '$50M PRODUCER' — then cut to Kristee speaking directly to camera

SETUP.text: Most agents think the path to luxury is saying no to small deals. Kristee Leonard — who sells over $50 million a year in Austin — does the opposite.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: luxury home exteriors, then cut to Kristee in interview setting

INSIGHT.text: She still takes rental clients. Still works with first-time buyers. And here's why: 'If you choose to take on that client, then you need to represent them just like if they were a multimillion dollar deal.' One of those rentals? Came from California. Turned into multiple referrals. She's not treating small clients well because it's nice — she's doing it because it's how you build a referral engine that compounds. The year she sold $50 million? She was still working rentals.
INSIGHT.production_note: Cut between Kristee speaking and text overlays of key phrases: 'SAME LEVEL OF SERVICE' / 'ONE RENTAL = MULTIPLE REFERRALS' / '$50M YEAR + STILL WORKING RENTALS'

REFRAME.text: You're not stuck because you're taking small deals. You're stuck because you're half-assing them while waiting for the big one. Treat every client like they're the referral source to your next ten — because they are.
REFRAME.production_note: Direct to camera, tight shot on Kristee's face for authority

CTA.text: Think about your last small client. Did you give them the same energy as your biggest deal? If not — that's the gap. Full episode in bio.
CTA.production_note: End card: 'FULL EPISODE: LINK IN BIO' with podcast artwork

caption: The $50M agent still works rentals. Here's why that's the strategy, not the sacrifice.
share_trigger: identity — validates agents who work 'all levels' while challenging those who ghost small clients
